text: A roll of the birth of Jesus Christ, son of David, son of Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abraham begat Isaac, and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob begat Judah and his brethren,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Judah begat Pharez and Zarah of Tamar, and Pharez begat Hezron, and Hezron begat Ram,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Ram begat Amminadab, and Amminadab begat Nahshon, and Nahshon begat Salmon,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Salmon begat Boaz of Rahab, and Boaz begat Obed of Ruth, and Obed begat Jesse,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jesse begat David the king. And David the king begat Solomon, of her [who had been] Uriah's,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Solomon begat Rehoboam, and Rehoboam begat Abijah, and Abijah begat Asa,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Asa begat Jehoshaphat, and Jehoshaphat begat Joram, and Joram begat Uzziah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Uzziah begat Jotham, and Jotham begat Ahaz, and Ahaz begat Hezekiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Hezekiah begat Manasseh, and Manasseh begat Amon, and Amon begat Josiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Josiah begat Jeconiah and his brethren, at the Babylonian removal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the Babylonian removal, Jeconiah begat Shealtiel, and Shealtiel begat Zerubbabel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Zerubbabel begat Abiud, and Abiud begat Eliakim, and Eliakim begat Azor,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Azor begat Sadok, and Sadok begat Achim, and Achim begat Eliud,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Eliud begat Eleazar, and Eleazar begat Matthan, and Matthan begat Jacob,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jacob begat Joseph, the husband of Mary, of whom was begotten Jesus, who is named Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the generations, therefore, from Abraham unto David [are] fourteen generations, and from David unto the Babylonian removal fourteen generations, and from the Babylonian removal unto the Christ, fourteen generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: And of Jesus Christ, the birth was thus: For his mother Mary having been betrothed to Joseph, before their coming together she was found to have conceived from the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joseph her husband being righteous, and not willing to make her an example, did wish privately to send her away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on his thinking of these things, lo, a messenger of the Lord in a dream appeared to him, saying, `Joseph, son of David, thou mayest not fear to receive Mary thy wife, for that which in her was begotten [is] of the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: and she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus, for he shall save his people from their sins.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And all this hath come to pass, that it may be fulfilled that was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: `Lo, the virgin shall conceive, and she shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel,' which is, being interpreted `With us [he is] God.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph, having risen from the sleep, did as the messenger of the Lord directed him, and received his wife,
speaker: Narrator

text: and did not know her till she brought forth her son -- the first-born, and he called his name Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus having been born in Beth-Lehem of Judea, in the days of Herod the king, lo, mages from the east came to Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, `Where is he who was born king of the Jews? for we saw his star in the east, and we came to bow to him.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Herod the king having heard, was stirred, and all Jerusalem with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he was inquiring from them where the Christ is born.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to him, `In Beth-Lehem of Judea, for thus it hath been written through the prophet,
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou, Beth-Lehem, the land of Judah, thou art by no means the least among the leaders of Judah, for out of thee shall come one leading, who shall feed My people Israel.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Herod, privately having called the mages, did inquire exactly from them the time of the appearing star,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having sent them to Beth-Lehem, he said, `Having gone -- inquire ye exactly for the child, and whenever ye may have found, bring me back word, that I also having come may bow to him.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And they, having heard the king, departed, and lo, the star, that they did see in the east, did go before them, till, having come, it stood over where the child was.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having seen the star, they rejoiced with exceeding great joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having come to the house, they found the child with Mary his mother, and having fallen down they bowed to him, and having opened their treasures, they presented to him gifts, gold, and frankincense, and myrrh,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having been divinely warned in a dream not to turn back unto Herod, through another way they withdrew to their own region.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on their having withdrawn, lo, a messenger of the Lord doth appear in a dream to Joseph, saying, `Having risen, take the child and his mother, and flee to Egypt, and be thou there till I may speak to thee, for Herod is about to seek the child to destroy him.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And he, having risen, took the child and his mother by night, and withdrew to Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he was there till the death of Herod, that it might be fulfilled that was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, `Out of Egypt I did call My Son.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Herod, having seen that he was deceived by the mages, was very wroth, and having sent forth, he slew all the male children in Beth-Lehem, and in all its borders, from two years and under, according to the time that he inquired exactly from the mages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then was fulfilled that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: `A voice in Ramah was heard -- lamentation and weeping and much mourning -- Rachel weeping [for] her children, and she would not be comforted because they are not.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Herod having died, lo, a messenger of the Lord in a dream doth appear to Joseph in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, `Having risen, take the child and his mother, and be going to the land of Israel, for they have died -- those seeking the life of the child.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And he, having risen, took the child and his mother, and came to the land of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having heard that Archelaus doth reign over Judea instead of Herod his father, he was afraid to go thither, and having been divinely warned in a dream, he withdrew to the parts of Galilee,
speaker: Narrator

text: and coming, he dwelt in a city named Nazareth, that it might be fulfilled that was spoken through the prophets, that `A Nazarene he shall be called.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And in those days cometh John the Baptist, proclaiming in the wilderness of Judea,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, `Reform, for come nigh hath the reign of the heavens,'
speaker: Narrator

text: for this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying, `A voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, straight make ye His paths.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And this John had his clothing of camel's hair, and a girdle of skin round his loins, and his nourishment was locusts and honey of the field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then were going forth unto him Jerusalem, and all Judea, and all the region round about the Jordan,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they were baptized in the Jordan by him, confessing their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having seen many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming about his baptism, he said to them, `Brood of vipers! who did shew you to flee from the coming wrath?
speaker: Narrator

text: bear, therefore, fruits worthy of the reformation,
speaker: Narrator

text: and do not think to say in yourselves, A father we have -- Abraham, for I say to you, that God is able out of these stones to raise children to Abraham,
speaker: Narrator

text: and now also, the axe unto the root of the trees is laid, every tree therefore not bearing good fruit is hewn down, and to fire is cast.
speaker: Narrator

text: `I indeed do baptize you with water to reformation, but he who after me is coming is mightier than I, of whom I am not worthy to bear the sandals, he shall baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: whose fan [is] in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his floor, and will gather his wheat to the storehouse, but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Then cometh Jesus from Galilee upon the Jordan, unto John to be baptized by him,
speaker: Narrator

text: but John was forbidding him, saying, `I have need by thee to be baptized -- and thou dost come unto me!'
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus answering said to him, `Suffer now, for thus it is becoming to us to fulfill all righteousness,' then he doth suffer him.
speaker: Jesus

text: And having been baptized, Jesus went up immediately from the water, and lo, opened to him were the heavens, and he saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming upon him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and lo, a voice out of the heavens, saying, `This is My Son -- the Beloved, in whom I did delight.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus was led up to the wilderness by the Spirit, to be tempted by the Devil,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having fasted forty days and forty nights, afterwards he did hunger.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Tempter having come to him said, `If Son thou art of God -- speak that these stones may become loaves.'
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answering said, `It hath been written, Not upon bread alone doth man live, but upon every word coming forth from the mouth of God.'
speaker: Jesus

text: Then doth the Devil take him to the [holy] city, and doth set him on the pinnacle of the temple,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saith to him, `If Son thou art of God -- cast thyself down, for it hath been written, that, His messengers He shall charge concerning thee, and on hands they shall bear thee up, that thou mayest not dash on a stone thy foot.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him again, `It hath been written, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.'
speaker: Jesus

text: Again doth the Devil take him to a very high mount, and doth shew to him all the kingdoms of the world and the glory of them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saith to him, `All these to thee I will give, if falling down thou mayest bow to me.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Then saith Jesus to him, `Go -- Adversary, for it hath been written, The Lord thy God thou shalt bow to, and Him only thou shalt serve.'
speaker: Jesus

text: Then doth the Devil leave him, and lo, messengers came and were ministering to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus having heard that John was delivered up, did withdraw to Galilee,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having left Nazareth, having come, he dwelt at Capernaum that is by the sea, in the borders of Zebulun and Naphtalim,
speaker: Narrator

text: that it might be fulfilled that was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: `Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali, way of the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations! --
speaker: Narrator

text: the people that is sitting in darkness saw a great light, and to those sitting in a region and shadow of death -- light arose to them.'
speaker: Narrator

text: From that time began Jesus to proclaim and to say, `Reform ye, for come nigh hath the reign of the heavens.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus, walking by the sea of Galilee, saw two brothers, Simon named Peter and Andrew his brother, casting a drag into the sea -- for they were fishers --
speaker: Narrator

text: and he saith to them, `Come ye after me, and I will make you fishers of men,'
speaker: Narrator

text: and they, immediately, having left the nets, did follow him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having advanced thence, he saw other two brothers, James of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, refitting their nets, and he called them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they, immediately, having left the boat and their father, did follow him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus was going about all Galilee teaching in their synagogues, and proclaiming the good news of the reign, and healing every disease, and every malady among the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his fame went forth to all Syria, and they brought to him all having ailments, pressed with manifold sicknesses and pains, and demoniacs, and lunatics, and paralytics, and he healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there followed him many multitudes from Galilee, and Decapolis, and Jerusalem, and Judea, and beyond the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having seen the multitudes, he went up to the mount, and he having sat down, his disciples came to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having opened his mouth, he was teaching them, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text: `Happy the poor in spirit -- because theirs is the reign of the heavens.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Happy the mourning -- because they shall be comforted.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Happy the meek -- because they shall inherit the land.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Happy those hungering and thirsting for righteousness -- because they shall be filled.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Happy the kind -- because they shall find kindness.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Happy the clean in heart -- because they shall see God.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Happy the peacemakers -- because they shall be called Sons of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Happy those persecuted for righteousness' sake -- because theirs is the reign of the heavens.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Happy are ye whenever they may reproach you, and may persecute, and may say any evil thing against you falsely for my sake --
speaker: Jesus

text: rejoice ye and be glad, because your reward [is] great in the heavens, for thus did they persecute the prophets who were before you.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Ye are the salt of the land, but if the salt may lose savour, in what shall it be salted? for nothing is it good henceforth, except to be cast without, and to be trodden down by men.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Ye are the light of the world, a city set upon a mount is not able to be hid;
speaker: Jesus

text: nor do they light a lamp, and put it under the measure, but on the lamp-stand, and it shineth to all those in the house;
speaker: Jesus

text: so let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works, and may glorify your Father who [is] in the heavens.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Do not suppose that I came to throw down the law or the prophets -- I did not come to throw down, but to fulfill;
speaker: Jesus

text: for, verily I say to you, till that the heaven and the earth may pass away, one iota or one tittle may not pass away from the law, till that all may come to pass.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Whoever therefore may loose one of these commands -- the least -- and may teach men so, least he shall be called in the reign of the heavens, but whoever may do and may teach [them], he shall be called great in the reign of the heavens.
speaker: Jesus

text: `For I say to you, that if your righteousness may not abound above that of the scribes and Pharisees, ye may not enter to the reign of the heavens.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Ye heard that it was said to the ancients: Thou shalt not kill, and whoever may kill shall be in danger of the judgment;
speaker: Jesus

text: but I -- I say to you, that every one who is angry at his brother without cause, shall be in danger of the judgment, and whoever may say to his brother, Empty fellow! shall be in danger of the sanhedrim, and whoever may say, Rebel! shall be in danger of the gehenna of the fire.
speaker: Jesus

text: `If, therefore, thou mayest bring thy gift to the altar, and there mayest remember that thy brother hath anything against thee,
speaker: Jesus

text: leave there thy gift before the altar, and go -- first be reconciled to thy brother, and then having come bring thy gift.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Be agreeing with thy opponent quickly, while thou art in the way with him, that the opponent may not deliver thee to the judge, and the judge may deliver thee to the officer, and to prison thou mayest be cast,
speaker: Jesus

text: verily I say to thee, thou mayest not come forth thence till that thou mayest pay the last farthing.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Ye heard that it was said to the ancients: Thou shalt not commit adultery;
speaker: Jesus

text: but I -- I say to you, that every one who is looking on a woman to desire her, did already commit adultery with her in his heart.
speaker: Jesus

text: `But, if thy right eye doth cause thee to stumble, pluck it out and cast from thee, for it is good to thee that one of thy members may perish, and not thy whole body be cast to gehenna.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And, if thy right hand doth cause thee to stumble, cut it off, and cast from thee, for it is good to thee that one of thy members may perish, and not thy whole body be cast to gehenna.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And it was said, That whoever may put away his wife, let him give to her a writing of divorce;
speaker: Jesus

text: but I -- I say to you, that whoever may put away his wife, save for the matter of whoredom, doth make her to commit adultery; and whoever may marry her who hath been put away doth commit adultery.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Again, ye heard that it was said to the ancients: Thou shalt not swear falsely, but thou shalt pay to the Lord thine oaths;
speaker: Jesus

text: but I -- I say to you, not to swear at all; neither by the heaven, because it is the throne of God,
speaker: Jesus

text: nor by the earth, because it is His footstool, nor by Jerusalem, because it is a city of a great king,
speaker: Jesus

text: nor by thy head mayest thou swear, because thou art not able one hair to make white or black;
speaker: Jesus

text: but let your word be, Yes, Yes, No, No, and that which is more than these is of the evil.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Ye heard that it was said: Eye for eye, and tooth for tooth;
speaker: Jesus

text: but I -- I say to you, not to resist the evil, but whoever shall slap thee on thy right cheek, turn to him also the other;
speaker: Jesus

text: and whoever is willing to take thee to law, and thy coat to take -- suffer to him also the cloak.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And whoever shall impress thee one mile, go with him two,
speaker: Jesus

text: to him who is asking of thee be giving, and him who is willing to borrow from thee thou mayest not turn away.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Ye heard that it was said: Thou shalt love thy neighbor, and shalt hate thine enemy;
speaker: Jesus

text: but I -- I say to you, Love your enemies, bless those cursing you, do good to those hating you, and pray for those accusing you falsely, and persecuting you,
speaker: Jesus

text: that ye may be sons of your Father in the heavens, because His sun He doth cause to rise on evil and good, and He doth send rain on righteous and unrighteous.
speaker: Jesus

text: `For, if ye may love those loving you, what reward have ye? do not also the tax-gatherers the same?
speaker: Jesus

text: and if ye may salute your brethren only, what do ye abundant? do not also the tax-gatherers so?
speaker: Jesus

text: ye shall therefore be perfect, as your Father who [is] in the heavens is perfect.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Take heed your kindness not to do before men, to be seen by them, and if not -- reward ye have not from your Father who [is] in the heavens;
speaker: Jesus

text: whenever, therefore, thou mayest do kindness, thou mayest not sound a trumpet before thee as the hypocrites do, in the synagogues, and in the streets, that they may have glory from men; verily I say to you -- they have their reward!
speaker: Jesus

text: `But thou, doing kindness, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand doth,
speaker: Jesus

text: that thy kindness may be in secret, and thy Father who is seeing in secret Himself shall reward thee manifestly.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And when thou mayest pray, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites, because they love in the synagogues, and in the corners of the broad places -- standing -- to pray, that they may be seen of men; verily I say to you, that they have their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: `But thou, when thou mayest pray, go into thy chamber, and having shut thy door, pray to thy Father who [is] in secret, and thy Father who is seeing in secret, shall reward thee manifestly.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And -- praying -- ye may not use vain repetitions like the nations, for they think that in their much speaking they shall be heard,
speaker: Jesus

text: be ye not therefore like to them, for your Father doth know those things that ye have need of before your asking him;
speaker: Jesus

text: thus therefore pray ye: `Our Father who [art] in the heavens! hallowed be Thy name.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Thy reign come: Thy will come to pass, as in heaven also on the earth.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Our appointed bread give us to-day.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And forgive us our debts, as also we forgive our debtors.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And mayest Thou not lead us to temptation, but deliver us from the evil, because Thine is the reign, and the power, and the glory -- to the ages. Amen.
speaker: Jesus

text: `For, if ye may forgive men their trespasses He also will forgive you -- your Father who [is] in the heavens;
speaker: Jesus

text: but if ye may not forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And when ye may fast, be ye not as the hypocrites, of sour countenances, for they disfigure their faces, that they may appear to men fasting; verily I say to you, that they have their reward.
speaker: Jesus

text: `But thou, fasting, anoint thy head, and wash thy face,
speaker: Jesus

text: that thou mayest not appear to men fasting, but to thy Father who [is] in secret, and thy Father, who is seeing in secret, shall reward thee manifestly.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Treasure not up to yourselves treasures on the earth, where moth and rust disfigure, and where thieves break through and steal,
speaker: Jesus

text: but treasure up to yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth disfigure, and where thieves do not break through nor steal,
speaker: Jesus

text: for where your treasure is, there will be also your heart.
speaker: Jesus

text: `The lamp of the body is the eye, if, therefore, thine eye may be perfect, all thy body shall be enlightened,
speaker: Jesus

text: but if thine eye may be evil, all thy body shall be dark; if, therefore, the light that [is] in thee is darkness -- the darkness, how great!
speaker: Jesus

text: `None is able to serve two lords, for either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will hold to the one, and despise the other; ye are not able to serve God and Mammon.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Because of this I say to you, be not anxious for your life, what ye may eat, and what ye may drink, nor for your body, what ye may put on. Is not the life more than the nourishment, and the body than the clothing?
speaker: Jesus

text: look to the fowls of the heaven, for they do not sow, nor reap, nor gather into storehouses, and your heavenly Father doth nourish them; are not ye much better than they?
speaker: Jesus

text: `And who of you, being anxious, is able to add to his age one cubit?
speaker: Jesus

text: and about clothing why are ye anxious? consider well the lilies of the field; how do they grow? they do not labour, nor do they spin;
speaker: Jesus

text: and I say to you, that not even Solomon in all his glory was arrayed as one of these.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And if the herb of the field, that to-day is, and to-morrow is cast to the furnace, God doth so clothe -- not much more you, O ye of little faith?
speaker: Jesus

text: therefore ye may not be anxious, saying, What may we eat? or, What may we drink? or, What may we put round?
speaker: Jesus

text: for all these do the nations seek for, for your heavenly Father doth know that ye have need of all these;
speaker: Jesus

text: but seek ye first the reign of God and His righteousness, and all these shall be added to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: Be not therefore anxious for the morrow, for the morrow shall be anxious for its own things; sufficient for the day [is] the evil of it.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Judge not, that ye may not be judged,
speaker: Jesus

text: for in what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged, and in what measure ye measure, it shall be measured to you.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And why dost thou behold the mote that [is] in thy brother's eye, and the beam that [is] in thine own eye dost not consider?
speaker: Jesus

text: or, how wilt thou say to thy brother, Suffer I may cast out the mote from thine eye, and lo, the beam [is] in thine own eye?
speaker: Jesus

text: Hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then thou shalt see clearly to cast out the mote out of thy brother's eye.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Ye may not give that which is [holy] to the dogs, nor cast your pearls before the swine, that they may not trample them among their feet, and having turned -- may rend you.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Ask, and it shall be given to you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened to you;
speaker: Jesus

text: for every one who is asking doth receive, and he who is seeking doth find, and to him who is knocking it shall be opened.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Or what man is of you, of whom, if his son may ask a loaf -- a stone will he present to him?
speaker: Jesus

text: and if a fish he may ask -- a serpent will he present to him?
speaker: Jesus

text: if, therefore, ye being evil, have known good gifts to give to your children, how much more shall your Father who [is] in the heavens give good things to those asking him?
speaker: Jesus

text: `All things, therefore, whatever ye may will that men may be doing to you, so also do to them, for this is the law and the prophets.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Go ye in through the strait gate, because wide [is] the gate, and broad the way that is leading to the destruction, and many are those going in through it;
speaker: Jesus

text: how strait [is] the gate, and compressed the way that is leading to the life, and few are those finding it!
speaker: Jesus

text: `But, take heed of the false prophets, who come unto you in sheep's clothing, and inwardly are ravening wolves.
speaker: Jesus

text: From their fruits ye shall know them; do [men] gather from thorns grapes? or from thistles figs?
speaker: Jesus

text: so every good tree doth yield good fruits, but the bad tree doth yield evil fruits.
speaker: Jesus

text: A good tree is not able to yield evil fruits, nor a bad tree to yield good fruits.
speaker: Jesus

text: Every tree not yielding good fruit is cut down and is cast to fire:
speaker: Jesus

text: therefore from their fruits ye shall know them.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Not every one who is saying to me Lord, lord, shall come into the reign of the heavens; but he who is doing the will of my Father who is in the heavens.
speaker: Jesus

text: Many will say to me in that day, Lord, lord, have we not in thy name prophesied? and in thy name cast out demons? and in thy name done many mighty things?
speaker: Jesus

text: and then I will acknowledge to them, that -- I never knew you, depart from me ye who are working lawlessness.
speaker: Jesus

text: `Therefore, every one who doth hear of me these words, and doth do them, I will liken him to a wise man who built his house upon the rock;
speaker: Jesus

text: and the rain did descend, and the streams came, and the winds blew, and they beat on that house, and it fell not, for it had been founded on the rock.
speaker: Jesus

text: `And every one who is hearing of me these words, and is not doing them, shall be likened to a foolish man who built his house upon the sand;
speaker: Jesus

text: and the rain did descend, and the streams came, and the winds blew, and they beat on that house, and it fell, and its fall was great.'
speaker: Jesus

text: And it came to pass, when Jesus ended these words, the multitudes were astonished at his teaching,
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Fools and blind! for which [is] greater, the gift, or the altar that is sanctifying the gift?
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: and having taken counsel, they bought with them the field of the potter, for the burial of strangers;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore was that field called, `Field of blood,' unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then was fulfilled that spoken through Jeremiah the prophet, saying, `And I took the thirty silverlings, the price of him who hath been priced, whom they of the sons of Israel did price,
speaker: Narrator

text: and gave them for the field of the potter, as the Lord did appoint to me.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus stood before the governor, and the governor did question him, saying, `Art thou the king of the Jews!' And Jesus said to him, `Thou sayest.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And in his being accused by the chief priests and the elders, he did not answer any thing,
speaker: Narrator

text: then saith Pilate to him, `Dost thou not hear how many things they witness against thee?'
speaker: Narrator

text: And he did not answer him, not even to one word, so that the governor did wonder greatly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the feast the governor had been accustomed to release one to the multitude, a prisoner, whom they willed,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they had then a noted prisoner, called Barabbas,
speaker: Narrator

text: they therefore having been gathered together, Pilate said to them, `Whom will ye I shall release to you? Barabbas or Jesus who is called Christ?'
speaker: Narrator

text: for he had known that because of envy they had delivered him up.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as he is sitting on the tribunal, his wife sent unto him, saying, `Nothing -- to thee and to that righteous one, for many things did I suffer to-day in a dream because of him.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And the chief priests and the elders did persuade the multitudes that they might ask for themselves Barabbas, and might destroy Jesus;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the governor answering said to them, `Which of the two will ye [that] I shall release to you?' And they said, `Barabbas.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate saith to them, `What then shall I do with Jesus who is called Christ?' They all say to him, `Let be crucified!'
speaker: Narrator

text: And the governor said, `Why, what evil did he?' and they were crying out the more, saying, `Let be crucified.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate having seen that it profiteth nothing, but rather a tumult is made, having taken water, he did wash the hands before the multitude, saying, `I am innocent from the blood of this righteous one; ye -- ye shall see;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the people answering said, `His blood [is] upon us, and upon our children!'
speaker: Narrator

text: Then did he release to them Barabbas, and having scourged Jesus, he delivered [him] up that he may be crucified;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the soldiers of the governor having taken Jesus to the Praetorium, did gather to him all the band;
speaker: Narrator

text: and having unclothed him, they put around him a crimson cloak,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having plaited him a crown out of thorns they put [it] on his head, and a reed in his right hand, and having kneeled before him, they were mocking him, saying, `Hail, the king of the Jews.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And having spit on him, they took the reed, and were smiting on his head;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when they had mocked him, they took off from him the cloak, and put on him his own garments, and led him away to crucify [him].
speaker: Narrator

text: And coming forth, they found a man, a Cyrenian, by name Simon: him they impressed that he might bear his cross;
speaker: Narrator

text: and having come to a place called Golgotha, that is called Place of a Skull,
speaker: Narrator

text: they gave him to drink vinegar mixed with gall, and having tasted, he would not drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having crucified him, they divided his garments, casting a lot, that it might be fulfilled that was spoken by the prophet, `They divided my garments to themselves, and over my vesture they cast a lot;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and sitting down, they were watching him there,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they put up over his head, his accusation written, `This is Jesus, the king of the Jews.'
speaker: Narrator

text: Then crucified with him are two robbers, one on the right hand, and one on the left,
speaker: Narrator

text: and those passing by were speaking evil of him, wagging their heads,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, `Thou that art throwing down the sanctuary, and in three days building [it], save thyself; if Son thou art of God, come down from the cross.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And in like manner also the chief priests mocking, with the scribes and elders, said,
speaker: Narrator

text: `Others he saved; himself he is not able to save! If he be King of Israel, let him come down now from the cross, and we will believe him;
speaker: Narrator

text: he hath trusted on God, let Him now deliver him, if He wish him, because he said -- Son of God I am;'
speaker: Narrator

text: with the same also the robbers, who were crucified with him, were reproaching him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from the sixth hour darkness came over all the land unto the ninth hour,
speaker: Narrator

text: and about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a great voice, saying, `Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?' that is, `My God, my God, why didst Thou forsake me?'
speaker: Narrator

text: And certain of those standing there having heard, said -- `Elijah he doth call;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and immediately, one of them having run, and having taken a spunge, having filled [it] with vinegar, and having put [it] on a reed, was giving him to drink,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the rest said, `Let alone, let us see if Elijah doth come -- about to save him.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus having again cried with a great voice, yielded the spirit;
speaker: Narrator

text: and lo, the vail of the sanctuary was rent in two from top unto bottom, and the earth did quake, and the rocks were rent,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the tombs were opened, and many bodies of the saints who have fallen asleep, arose,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having come forth out of the tombs after his rising, they went into the holy city, and appeared to many.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the centurion, and those with him watching Jesus, having seen the earthquake, and the things that were done, were exceedingly afraid, saying, `Truly this was God's Son.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And there were there many women beholding from afar, who did follow Jesus from Galilee, ministering to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: among whom was Mary the Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James and of Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And evening having come, there came a rich man, from Arimathea, named Joseph, who also himself was discipled to Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: he having gone near to Pilate, asked for himself the body of Jesus; then Pilate commanded the body to be given back.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having taken the body, Joseph wrapped it in clean linen,
speaker: Narrator

text: and laid it in his new tomb, that he hewed in the rock, and having rolled a great stone to the door of the tomb, he went away;
speaker: Narrator

text: and there were there Mary the Magdalene, and the other Mary, sitting over-against the sepulchre.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the morrow that is after the preparation, were gathered together the chief priests, and the Pharisees, unto Pilate,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, `Sir, we have remembered that that deceiver said while yet living, After three days I do rise;
speaker: Narrator

text: command, then, the sepulchre to be made secure till the third day, lest his disciples, having come by night, may steal him away, and may say to the people, He rose from the dead, and the last deceit shall be worse than the first.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And Pilate said to them, `Ye have a watch, go away, make secure -- as ye have known;'
speaker: Narrator

text: and they, having gone, did make the sepulchre secure, having sealed the stone, together with the watch.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the eve of the sabbaths, at the dawn, toward the first of the sabbaths, came Mary the Magdalene, and the other Mary, to see the sepulchre,
speaker: Narrator

text: and lo, there came a great earthquake, for a messenger of the Lord, having come down out of heaven, having come, did roll away the stone from the door, and was sitting upon it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and his countenance was as lightning, and his clothing white as snow,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from the fear of him did the keepers shake, and they became as dead men.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the messenger answering said to the women, `Fear not ye, for I have known that Jesus, who hath been crucified, ye seek;
speaker: Narrator

text: he is not here, for he rose, as he said; come, see the place where the Lord was lying;
speaker: Narrator

text: and having gone quickly, say ye to his disciples, that he rose from the dead; and lo, he doth go before you to Galilee, there ye shall see him; lo, I have told you.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And having gone forth quickly from the tomb, with fear and great joy, they ran to tell to his disciples;
speaker: Narrator

text: and as they were going to tell to his disciples, then lo, Jesus met them, saying, `Hail!' and they having come near, laid hold of his feet, and did bow to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then saith Jesus to them, `Fear ye not, go away, tell to my brethren that they may go away to Galilee, and there they shall see me.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And while they are going on, lo, certain of the watch having come to the city, told to the chief priests all the things that happened,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having been gathered together with the elders, counsel also having taken, they gave much money to the soldiers,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, `Say ye, that his disciples having come by night, stole him -- we being asleep;
speaker: Narrator

text: and if this be heard by the governor, we will persuade him, and you keep free from anxiety.'
speaker: Narrator

text: And they, having received the money, did as they were taught, and this account was spread abroad among Jews till this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the eleven disciples went to Galilee, to the mount where Jesus appointed them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and having seen him, they bowed to him, but some did waver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And having come near, Jesus spake to them, saying, `Given to me was all authority in heaven and on earth;
speaker: Narrator

text: having gone, then, disciple all the nations, (baptizing them -- to the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: teaching them to observe all, whatever I did command you,) and lo, I am with you all the days -- till the full end of the age.'
speaker: Narrator
